intro: Ballota foetida, commonly known as the stinking rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has a woody stem and produces trifoliate leaves with a distinctive, often unpleasant odor. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Ballota foetida is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
